intro.p: Home builders are often trying to decide what types of homes to build based on what they expect to sell. The US Census Bureau classifies housing into three types - single family homes, multi-family residential (homes with 2 to 4 units), and multi-family commercial (complexes with more than 5 units). Below is a summary of the number of new housing permits issued in 2022 in four geographic areas of the United states.

Use the table below to answer the questions. Make sure to show your computations and give your answers in full sentences with context from the scenario. Round your answer to four decimal places. Failure to show all computations or incorrect rounding may result in a score of "not mastered".

content.p: Calculate the totals for the cells labeled A, B, and C in the table.
What is the probability that a randomly selected permit is to build housing in the {{region_1}}?
What is the probability that a randomly selected permit is to build a {{type1}} or {{type2}} unit?
What is the probability that a randomly selected permit is for a unit in the {{region_2}} given that it is a permit to build a {{type3}}?
Which of the two below is more likely? Show all calculations that you use and provide an explanation as to why your final answer is the correct one.
* That a randomly selected permit is to build a {{region_3}} unit given that it is in the {{type4}}.
* That a randomly selected permit is a NOT in the {{region_4}} region.
